value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pbAL_zG-Pgo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available.  Looking for Part 1 video?  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewjRItLlgG8  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/keepfilters-function-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #84: Get values from another table with inactive relationships
value.excerpt: It is world's cup fever: FIFA world cup 2018 in Russia!!! And we dont want to miss anything right?  That is where Power BI comes to the rescue :)  I am going to build a Power BI file to follow the world cup and I decided to show you how I create it while creating it :)  In the first video, I downloaded

value.title: DAX Fridays! #87: DISTINCT vs DISTINCTCOUNT vs VALUES

value.title: DAX Fridays! #91: Sum child values into the parent
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to sum child values into the parent when you are dealing with hierarchies in Power BI.  This video is based on an example shown in the previous DAX Fridays! video, so I recommend you to watch that first: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8OWQ7Xl3m0  Happy holidays!

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions

value.title: All Function in Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: Welcome to one more episode of my "Wednesday with DAX" series for Power BI. value.title: DAX Functions Overview - Date and Time Function in Power BI

value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! value.title: Power BI DAX Measures: Understanding Filter Context using DATESYTD Example (I.C.A.N. Rule)
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” with the 4-easy-step approach of the I.C.A.N. value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.
